text.headline: Last great Roman-Persian War.
text.text: Long conflict leaves both empires exhausted and unable to cope with the newly united Arab armies under Islam in the 630s

text.headline: Grand Canal in China is fully completed
text.text: Its main role throughout its history was the transport of grain to the capital.

text.headline: Muhammad Migrates from Mecca to Medina
text.text: Event will have designated first year of the Islamic Calendar, as Anno Hegirae.

text.headline: Joint Persian-Avar-Slav Siege of Constantinople Constantinople saved
text.text: Avar power broken and Persians henceforth on the defensive

text.headline: Battle of Nineveh
text.text: The Byzantines, under Heraclius, crush the Persians.

text.headline: Death of Muhammed
text.text: By this point, all of Arabia is Muslim.

text.headline: Accession of Abu Bakr as first Caliph
text.text: Though the period of his caliphate was not long, it included successful invasions of the two most powerful empires of the time.

text.headline: Battle of Heavenfield
text.text: Northumbrian army under Oswald defeat Welsh army.

text.headline: Arab Army led by Omar Ibn Al-'Aas takes Alexandria
In Japan, the Soga clan falls
text.text: This initiates a period of imitation of Chinese culture, The Nara period begins a year later.

text.headline: Synod of Whitby
text.text: Roman Christianity triumphs over Celtic Christianity in England.

text.headline: Ends of the Three Kingdoms period in Korea
text.text: Established a Unified Silla which led to the North South States Period 30 years later.

text.headline: First Arab siege of Constantinople
text.text: First time Islamic armies defeated, forestalling Islamic conquest of Europe.

text.headline: Establishment of the Bulgarian Empire
text.text: A country with great influence in the European history in the Middle Ages.

text.headline: Battle of Dun Nechtain
text.text: Picts defeat Northumbrians, whose dominance ends.

text.headline: Battle of Tertry
text.text: Established Pepin of Herstal as mayor over the entire realms of Neustria and Austrasia, which further dwindled Merovingian power.

text.headline: Arab army takes Carthage
text.text: End of Byzantine rule in North Africa

text.headline: North South States Period begins in Korea
